metadata.title: CVE-2022-1205 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s AmateurRadio AX.25 protocol functionality in the way a user connects with theprotocol. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1049-dell300x - 4.15.0-1049.54
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1078-gke - 5.4.0-1078.84~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1049-gkeop - 5.4.0-1049.52~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1115-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1115.123
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1133-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1133.143
No subscription required
